markdownRemark.html:
FIXME: background and disclaimer (everyone have there own route). Lucky, acknowledge previlige and everyone have there own route.

1985

I was born in 1985. Most of my childhood I was messing around with computers. The wonders of our family 80286, magical games (Lemmings, Prince of Persia, Stunts, Golden Axe, etc), modifying the autoexec.bat file until it didn’t work anymore.

1996 First encounters with the Internet

Around 1996 my friend Jens introduced me to the Internet. I remember the excitement of chatting with people from all over the world, the wealth of information available but still not that accessible without good search engines. We spend time downloading HTML pages and modifying the markup and styling. Figuring out how it all worked was a lot of reverse engineering. I build a few websites on geocities.

1998 Part time tech jobs

Around 1998 I started worked part-time as graphical designer and webmaster for a few local companies. I expored books about user experience and design at the locale library. I didn’t know anything about programming, but started doing more and more HTML and some Flash applications.

2002 Building an online music community

Around 2002 I started working on an online community-based review for music, called CD guiden (never though the compact disc would go out of fashion) with my friend Jens using ASP and Flash. The site got pretty successful, and slowly I learned more and more about programming while expanding the site.

2004 Making a living designing and coding

After finishing high school in 2004, I started my own little webdesign/programming/graphics design studio. When starting out I didn’t know anything about running a business, how to get clients, accounting, pricing, etc. But I managed to make a living for some years helping people build websites and applications of various complexities.

2006-2012 Studying

In spring 2006 I moved to Copenhagen to study. Although I considered graphical design…
